Content: is BTC a stablecoin?

Content: yes, atomicDEX needs to get traction

Content: but with all the mandatory KYC, it could be that atomicDEX is the only place without the KYC...

Content: so KMD would only be for people who like to trade without KYC and get 5% while waiting for good prices on the orderbooks

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and the ecosystem currency

Author: acidbird#7266
Content: But can‚Äôt they block the app if they decide to change the rules? Regulators

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and for whatever other benefits ecosystem projects give to KMD, we see a lot of projects give preference to KMD, even though it isnt required

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: they can block atomicDEX as well as they can block torrents

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: how is that working out for them?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: will they start prosecuting grandma and their voters?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: for bartering

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: its not even copyright infringement, which they couldnt stop

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is a common law right to barter what you own

Author: acidbird#7266
Content: Noone knows but it is easier to block an app  or website then a torrent

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: at worst we need to host the download, maybe via torrent

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: in any case, atomicDEX is in the regulation safe harbor according to the latest guidance

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: they realized they cant make grandma have to get a money transmitter license for bartering

Author: acidbird#7266
Content: Yeah, i saw the guidelines, we are good so far, hopefully will get out of beta soon

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: also if the only problem is that atomicDEX gets too big that regulators are paying attention,then it is like bitmex

Author: acidbird#7266
Content: And shake the market üòé

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: by then it is way too late

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: as atomicDEX grows, the first thing people will realize is that all the markets are in KMD

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: what will they do?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: ERC20 all require ETH, so they are DOA as the base trading pair

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: what other coin will have the liquidity on atomicDEX AND pay 5%?

Author: acidbird#7266
Content: This logic is good, i like it, when we get there KMD will be doing great

Author: acidbird#7266
Content: I love 5,1%, it is a great idea.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: also, for non-ecosystem coins, nSPV wont work

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: which means they need to rely on the electrum servers or normal headers only SPV

Author: acidbird#7266
Content: Hmm, i didn‚Äôt know that, good point

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the reality is that there will be occasional maintenance issues with electrum servers and headers only SPV is actually quite slow, compared to nSPV

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: KMD will be the only top coin with nSPV

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: at least until other ecosystem coins become a top coin

Author: acidbird#7266
Content: How far away are we from this?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: #dev-nspv

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i already have a proof of concept working, the fullnode support is in jl777 branch already

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is a non-hardfork update

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: realistically, by end of year to get the atomicDEX with nSPV support, but by then it is iterated many times from all the feedback

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: trading within the ecosystem will then be able to scale basically without limits (other than blockchain capacity)

Author: acidbird#7266
Content: Great, will check it out. ok James, it was nice chatting with you, thank you for answers and info, have a great rest of the day! Cheers!
